description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the out-of-bounds memory access vulnerability affecting Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based):

1. Update your Microsoft Edge browser to the latest version (122.0.2365.52 or newer).
2. Restart the browser after the update to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- The update addresses the vulnerabilities derived from Chromium, specifically CVE-2024-1669, which allows remote attackers to exploit out-of-bounds memory access via specially crafted HTML pages.
- For the latest version details, visit the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) page.
- To check your current version of Microsoft Edge, click on the three dots (...) in the top right corner, navigate to Help and Feedback, and click on About Microsoft Edge.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure you have administrative privileges to perform the update.
- Backup your browser profile before proceeding to prevent any loss of data during the update process.
